content:
Here's a sample 4-week workout plan to help you prepare for your sprint triathlon on May 21st:

**Weeks 1-2: Base Building**

* **Monday (Swim):**
	+ Warm-up: 200m easy swimming
	+ 4x100m at moderate pace (30-40 seconds rest between each 100m)
	+ 2x200m at easy pace (20-30 seconds rest between each 200m)
	+ Cool-down: 200m easy swimming
* **Tuesday (Strength Training):**
	+ Pull-ups: 3 sets of 8-12 reps
	+ Dumbbell rows: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
	+ Shoulder rotations: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
* **Wednesday (Rest day)**
* **Thursday (Swim):**
	+ Warm-up: 200m easy swimming
	+ 3x200m at moderate pace (30-40 seconds rest between each 200m)
	+ 1x400m at easy pace
	+ Cool-down: 200m easy swimming
* **Friday (Cardio):**
	+ 20-30 minutes of easy running or cycling
* **Saturday (Rest day)**
* **Sunday (Swim):**
	+ Warm-up: 200m easy swimming
	+ 2x300m at moderate pace (30-40 seconds rest between each 300m)
	+ 1x200m at easy pace
	+ Cool-down: 200m easy swimming

**Weeks 3-4: Build and Intensity**

* **Monday (Swim):**
	+ Warm-up: 200m easy swimming
	+ 5x100m at high intensity (20-30 seconds rest between each 100m)
	+ 2x200m at moderate pace (20-30 seconds rest between each 200m)
	+ Cool-down: 200m easy swimming
* **Tuesday (Strength Training):**
	+ Pull-ups: 3 sets of 10-12 reps
	+ Dumbbell rows: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
	+ Shoulder rotations: 3 sets of 12-15 reps
* **Wednesday (Rest day)**
* **Thursday (Swim):**
	+ Warm-up: 200m easy swimming
	+ 3x250m at high intensity (20-30 seconds rest between each 250m)
	+ 1x200m at easy pace
	+ Cool-down: 200m easy swimming
* **Friday (Cardio):**
	+ 20-30 minutes of HIIT (High-Intensity Interval Training)
* **Saturday (Rest day)**
* **Sunday (Swim):**
	+ Warm-up: 200m easy swimming
	+ 2x350m at high intensity (20-30 seconds rest between each 350m)
	+ 1x200m at easy pace
	+ Cool-down: 200m easy swimming

**Additional Tips:**

* Warm up with 10-15 minutes of easy swimming before each swim workout.
* Incorporate drills and technique focus during your swim workouts.
* Rest and recovery are crucial. Make sure to listen to your body and take rest days as needed.
* Incorporate nutrition and hydration planning into your daily routine to support your training.
* Taper your training 7-10 days before your sprint triathlon to allow your body to rest and recover.

Remember, this is just a sample plan and you should adjust it based on your fitness level, schedule, and preferences. Make sure to consult with a doctor or a certified coach before starting any new exercise program. Good luck with your training, and I hope you crush your sprint triathlon on May 21st!
